intro: Mentzelia aspera var. virescens, commonly known as the greenleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in arid regions.
